_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Pipeline Transportation of Refined Petroleum Products

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
DESCRIPTION OF STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES:

The Oklahoma City Reno Terminal is a refined products bulk storage facility located in Oklahoma City, OK.  The 40 CFR 68 regulated substance at this facility is butane.  The equipment which handles butane includes three pressure vessels and associated piping.  The butane pressure vessels and associated piping may contain as much as 1,020,000 lbs of butane.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:

The Oklahoma City Reno Terminal has a strong commitment to worker and public safety, along with resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel and contractors in design, installation, operations and maintenance procedures.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the LEPC and request that they respond to the emergency.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND MAINTENANCE PROGRAM:

The regulated butane mixing process in the facility is compliant with all elements of Process Safety Management (PSM) and Risk Management Program (RMP) other employee training programs, along with operating and maintenance procedures. The process controls listed in Section 7.4e were chosen based on whether or not they were used as safeguards in last PHA for this facility.  There may be other process controls in this facility that were not identified as safeguards in the last PHA.  The facility has no "Trade Secrets".  The facility complies with the Federal and State requirements for leak detection of valves, pumps, and flanges.  Inspections are conducted and documented to ensure the integrity of the regulated equipment.



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There has been no accidental release from the butane process at the Oklahoma City Reno Terminal that has required reporting under the RMP rule.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The facility maintains a written Emergency Response Plan.  Within the past five years the butane process has had no accidental releases that have cau

sed offsite impacts provided in the RMP rule.  In the event of fire or explosion, or a release of a regulated substance from the process, entry within the distance to the specified endpoint may pose a danger to public emergency responders.  Therefore, emergency responders should not enter the area except as arranged with the emergency contact indicated within the RMP.  The undersigned certifies that to the best of my knowledge, information, and belief, the information submitted is true, accurate and complete.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

No changes are currently planned to the butane process.  As opportunities for improvement associated with the butane process arise at the Oklahoma City Reno Terminal, they will be evaluated by Magellan Pipeline Company, L.P.
